1.verse: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is according to godliness;

2.verse: In hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before the world began;

3.verse: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed to me according to the commandment of God our Savior;

4.verse: To Titus, my own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.

5.verse: For this cause I left thee in Crete, that thou shouldst set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

6.verse: If any is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, not accused of riot, or disorderly.

7.verse: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not self-willed, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

8.verse: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

9.verse: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

10.verse: For there are many disorderly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

11.verse: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for the sake of sordid gain.

12.verse: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are always liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

13.verse: This testimony is true: wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

14.verse: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men that turn from the truth.

15.verse: To the pure all things are pure: but to them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

16.verse: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and to every good work reprobate.

1.verse: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

2.verse: That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience;

3.verse: The aged women likewise, that they be in behavior as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

4.verse: That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

5.verse: To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

6.verse: Young men likewise exhort to be sober-minded.

7.verse: In all things showing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine showing incorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

8.verse: Sound speech that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say concerning you.

9.verse: Exhort servants to be obedient to their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;

10.verse: Not purloining, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things.

11.verse: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

12.verse: Teaching us, that denying ungodliness, and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and piously, in this present world;

13.verse: Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God, and our Savior Jesus Christ;

14.verse: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify to himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

15.verse: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

1.verse: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

2.verse: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, showing all meekness to all men.

3.verse: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

4.verse: But when the kindness and love of God our Savior towards man appeared,

5.verse: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Spirit;

6.verse: Which he shed on us abundantly, through Jesus Christ our Savior;

7.verse: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

8.verse: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they who have believed in God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men.

9.verse: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

10.verse: A man that is a heretic, after the first and second admonition, reject;

11.verse: Knowing that he who is such, is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned by himself.

12.verse: When I shall send Artemas to thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

13.verse: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing may be wanting to them.

14.verse: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.

15.verse: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
